meanings.definition: Give (someone) less than they are owed or deserve.
meanings.sent1: The store shortchanges customers by not giving them the correct change.
meanings.sent2: She felt upset when the company shortchanged her on her paycheck.
meanings.sent3: The magician shortchanges the audience by making the rabbit disappear without bringing it back.
meanings.sent4: The unreliable contractor shortchanges his clients by using cheap materials for construction.
meanings.sent5: The teacher shortchanges the students by not providing enough time for the exam.

meanings.definition: Cheat or swindle (someone) by giving them less than they are owed.
meanings.sent1: The scammer shortchanges unsuspecting victims by promising fake rewards.
meanings.sent2: He realized the salesman shortchanged him by selling him a faulty product.
meanings.sent3: The pickpocket shortchanges tourists by stealing their wallets without them noticing.
meanings.sent4: The con artist shortchanges his targets by manipulating them into giving him money.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest mechanic shortchanges customers by overcharging for unnecessary repairs.

meanings.definition: To treat someone unfairly by not giving them what they deserve.
meanings.sent1: The coach shortchanges talented players by not giving them enough playing time.
meanings.sent2: It's not right to shortchange employees by denying them their rightful promotions.
meanings.sent3: The boss shortchanges his assistant by taking credit for all the hard work.
meanings.sent4: The landlord shortchanges tenants by neglecting to make necessary repairs in the building.
meanings.sent5: The government should not shortchange citizens by cutting essential services.
